channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump and Canadian PM to meet today. And, the best Met Gala looks
item.description: Trump and Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney are set to meet today as tensions between their two countries rise. And, the best looks from last night's star-studded Met Gala.
item.content:encoded:
Trump and Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney are set to meet today as tensions between their two countries rise. And, the best looks from last night's star-studded Met Gala.

(Image credit: Dominic Gwinn)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Most Americans use federal science information on a weekly basis, a new poll finds
item.description: Most Americans frequently use federal science information. But few are concerned that cuts to federal science spending could affect their access to such information, a new poll finds.
item.content:encoded:
Most Americans frequently use federal science information. But few are concerned that cuts to federal science spending could affect their access to such information, a new poll finds.

(Image credit: Gemunu Amarasinghe)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Hersher

item.title: Trump has said Canada should be the 51st state. Today, he meets its prime minister
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney won the Canadian election vowing to take on President Trump. Tuesday, they meet for the first time in the Oval Office.
item.content:encoded:
Prime Minister Mark Carney won the Canadian election vowing to take on President Trump. Tuesday, they meet for the first time in the Oval Office.

(Image credit: Dominic Gwinn)
item.dc:creator: Lexie Schapitl

item.title: Critics warn DOJ is being politicized despite vows to end its purported weaponization
item.description: Critics warn that despite President Trump's call to end the purported weaponization of the Justice Department, it has become more politicized in the president's first three months back in office.
item.content:encoded:
Critics warn that despite President Trump's call to end the purported weaponization of the Justice Department, it has become more politicized in the president's first three months back in office.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Meet the Florida group chipping away at public benefits one state at a time
item.description: The Trump administration's "Make America Healthy Again" platform has boosted the agenda of a conservative think tank that's been working for more than a decade to reshape the nation's public assistance programs.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration's "Make America Healthy Again" platform has boosted the agenda of a conservative think tank that's been working for more than a decade to reshape the nation's public assistance programs.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Katheryn Houghton

item.title: Trump expands military use at the southern border. Are there legal limits?
item.description: The Posse Comitatus Act restricts using federal troops in civilian law enforcement. Exceptions exist, but Trump's crackdown on immigration is shaping up to be a major test for the law.
item.content:encoded:
The Posse Comitatus Act restricts using federal troops in civilian law enforcement. Exceptions exist, but Trump's crackdown on immigration is shaping up to be a major test for the law.

(Image credit: David Swanson)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: South Korea halted its adoption fraud investigation. Adoptees still demand the truth
item.description: The suspension of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission raises questions about future efforts to investigate the country's foreign adoption program.
item.content:encoded:
The suspension of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission raises questions about future efforts to investigate the country's foreign adoption program.

(Image credit: Ahn Young-joon)
item.dc:creator: Se Eun Gong

item.title: 20 years later, the Real ID deadline is here. Here's why it took so long
item.description: Real ID will be enforced in U.S. airports starting May 7. Implementing the law involved years of negotiations between federal and state officials.
item.content:encoded:
Real ID will be enforced in U.S. airports starting May 7. Implementing the law involved years of negotiations between federal and state officials.

(Image credit: Mike Stewart)
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: Rwanda says it's in 'early stages' of talks with U.S. to take in deported migrants
item.description: The tiny east African country of Rwanda says it's holding "early talks" with the Trump administration about taking in deported migrants from the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
The tiny east African country of Rwanda says it's holding "early talks" with the Trump administration about taking in deported migrants from the U.S.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: German lawmakers reject Friedrich Merz as chancellor in a stunning 1st round
item.description: The setback is a major embarrassment for the leader of the center-right Christian Democrats, less than three months after winning the most votes in Germany's federal election.
item.content:encoded:
The setback is a major embarrassment for the leader of the center-right Christian Democrats, less than three months after winning the most votes in Germany's federal election.

(Image credit: Markus Schreiber)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz
